name: No Mercy
description:
No Mercy, is an old school first person shooter, set in a universe where ancient creatures use the souls of the best warriors and soldiers for their own purposes. This souls are sent across dimensions to complete impossibles tasks, and resurrection is granted after completion. 

You have been sent in a dimension where the planet has been destroyed by a biochemical weapon that mutated life on earth, your mission is to find and destroy the AI that enslaved humanity, before it becomes smarth enough to travel across dimensions.

Controls:

  • Movement:  WASD.
  • Run: Right Shift pressed.
  • Jump: Space.
  • Flashlight: F.
  • Crouch: C.
  • Shoot: Left click.
  • Aim: Right click pressed.
  • Reload: R.
  • Granade: G.
  • RPG: V.
  • Change Weapon: 
  • Mouse scroll up = stronger weapon.
  • Mouse scroll down = weaker weapon.
  • Pause: ESC

Things to know before start playing:

  1. You can see your objective in the pause menu.
  2. You can't save, but there is a checkpoint after each stage of each level, you can reload your game from the main menu.
  3. The reload level option in the pause menu will reset all your ammo.

How to Dowload:

  1. Download the file from the page.
  2. Don't start the game from the .7zip file, ensure you have a software capable of reading .7zip file, like winRar or winZip and extract the folder.
  3. From the folder double click the file with a black logo named No_mercy.
  4. Have fun!

From the Developer:

Hi everyone, after 3 and half months is finally time to release No mercy, this is the first game I've ever created from scratch. I've been working on it during my spare time and the design is very simple:

  • 3 Levels.
  • 6 Weapons.
  • 3 enemy types.
  • 2 Bosses.
  • Approximately 1:30 / 2:00 hours of gameplay. 

I've been using free assets for the most with some assets packages that I bought long time ago while I was studying, if you are intrested, the assets are mentioned in the credits, just click the button in the main menu of the game.

Please, leave a comment below and tell me what you think, but keep in mind that the scope of creating this game was educational, so don't expect a masterpiece!! (Not yet).
